definition: fame follows merit (idiom)
real/true/honest/really/solid/fruit/seed/definitely
to arrive/most/to/until
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: Based on above, construction on financial laboratory platform of local colleges could be come into practice.
sentences.chinese: 使地方高校财经类示范实验室平台建设做到实至名归。

sentences.english: Therefore Mr. To truly deserves the PADI Instructor Development Award.
sentences.chinese: 因此，杜总监获颁PADI教练发展奖乃实至名归。

sentences.english: In fact, many seiyuu deserve this recognition.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，许多声优也是实至名归的。

sentences.english: We wait to see if this new approach actually materialises.
sentences.chinese: 我们期待目睹他的全新方式是否真正实至名归。
不过sexting拔得头筹是实至名归。

sentences.english: Indeed, the reasoning behind the awarding of the prize to previous American presidents has been easier to discern.
sentences.chinese: 之前几位获得诺贝尔和平奖的美国总统的确实至名归。

sentences.english: He is well worth the Golden Glove award so congratulations to him.
sentences.chinese: 他获得金手套奖乃实至名归，在这里我也要恭喜他。

definition: fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
name/term of address/title
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
award/prize/CL:項|项[xiang4]
laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
to award/to confer on (sb)
honor/credit/glory/(honorable) reputation/honorary
to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
(of a list, music chart etc) to reach the top
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
to live up to expectations (idiom)
to have an undeserved reputation (idiom)
prize/award/encouragement/CL:個|个[ge4]
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
to have a clear conscience/to feel no qualms
